required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety Study of Ibuprofen Gel Compared to Placebo in the Treatment of Acute Musculoskeletal Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Double-Blind, Parallel, Phase III Superiority Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Ibuprofen Gel Compared With Placebo in the Treatment of Acute Musculoskeletal Pain

lead_sponsor.agency: Brainfarma Industria Química e Farmacêutica S/A

clinical_study.source: Brainfarma Industria Química e Farmacêutica S/A

brief_summary.textblock: Phase III clinical trial, multicentre of superiority, randomized, double-blind, parallel groups, placebo-controlled and use of ibuprofen gel in the treatment of acute pain.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study is designed for the relief of acute musculoskeletal pain, characterized by pain in muscles, ligaments, tendons, and nerves.
It is performed in participants of both sexes, over 18 years of age, who have pain of moderate intensity as a result of ankle sprains, upper limb contusions, thigh muscle strains, or torticollis.
The rationale for studying the topical use of ibuprofen is the possibility of an alternative treatment for musculoskeletal pain, avoiding systemic adverse events caused by oral administration.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Superiority of ibuprofen gel over placebo in the treatment of acute musculoskeletal pain.
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint of the study is the proportion of participants achieving at least 50% pain reduction on day 5 of treatment by assessing pain intensity using the Visual Analog Scale (VAS), compared to baseline VAS. (Scale = 0 to 10; 0 = mild pain and 10 = severe pain)

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain relief with study medication on days 3, 5, and 7.
secondary_outcome.description: Pain relief by the adapted Pain Relief (PAR) Scale, with the 5 categories: 0 - no relief, 1- slight relief, 2 - moderate relief, 3 - considerable relief, and 4 - complete relief, on days 3, 5, and 7.

secondary_outcome.measure: Interference of pain on physical activity on days 3, 5 and 7
secondary_outcome.description: Pain interference with physical activity by 4-point scale: 0 - no interference with physical activity; 1 - no restriction of physical activity, although some pain on movement; 2 - some restriction of physical activity, but not enough to prevent normal activity; 3 - unable to perform normal activities and with substantial limiting effects, on days 3, 5, and 7.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 7 days
secondary_outcome.description: Time needed for pain improvement (reduction of at least 50% of pain on the VAS scale)

secondary_outcome.measure: Obtain the overall assessment of effectiveness, performed by the participant at the end of the treatment.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 7 days
secondary_outcome.description: Overall assessment of treatment by participant using 5-point scale: bad, fair, good, very good, and excellent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Obtain the overall efficacy evaluation, performed by the investigator at the end of the treatment.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 7 days
secondary_outcome.description: Overall assessment of treatment by physician using 5-point scale: bad, fair, good, very good, and excellent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants using rescue medication.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 7 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to use of rescue medication.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 7 days

other_outcome.measure: Occurrence of adverse events (AEs) during the study period.
other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 7 days
other_outcome.description: Rate of occurrence of serious and non-serious AEs, related and unrelated to treatment groups throughout the clinical trial.

intervention.description: Ibuprofen gel 5% topically four times a day
Placebo gel topically four times a day

overall_official.affiliation: Brainfarma Industria Química e Farmacêutica S/A

overall_contact.last_name: Cosmed Indústria de Cosméticos e Medicamentos S/A
